arm_group.description: All new cases of clinical diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome

brief_summary.textblock:
The prevalence of IBS in the community has been reported in numerous cross-sectional
      surveys. However, less is known about the incidence of IBS ,mainly due to its slow
      development and to patients under-reporting. Furthermore, only one study has analyzed data
      concerning potential risk factors for the diagnosis of IBS. The investigators will examine
      the incidence of IBS in a large cohort of young adults and will look at the association of
      socioeconomic, anthropometric and occupational factors with IBS incidence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Factors for a Clinical Diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome in a Large Cohort of Young Adults.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All Israeli men and women

          -  aged 18-39 years

          -  served in active military service (mandatory and career service) between the years
             2005-2011

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of celiac disease

          -  Inflammatory bowel disease

          -  Cancer in the digestive system

study_pop.textblock:
The study population will consist of Israeli men and women aged 18-39 years who served in
        active military service (mandatory and career service) between the years 2005-2011

keyword: Deterioration in the severity of irritable bowel syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Factors for a Clinical Diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome in a Large Cohort of 440,822 Young Adults.

primary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome during this priod
primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of clinical diagnosis of  irritable bowel syndrome

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Anthropometric and demographic factors predictive for the clinicaldiagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome including gender, body mass index, ethnicity , type of service
secondary_outcome.measure: predictive factors for the clinical diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
